items.summary: Microplastic pollution on Sydney's beaches and harbour shorelines has tripled in the past three years, according to a report, much of it from sources of "preventable losses".

items.title: Coco Gauff backed by Iga Świątek after smashing racquet at Australian Open
items.summary: Iga Świątek defends Coco Gauff after footage was shown of the American smashing a racquet at the Australian Open.

items.title: Tony Abbott intervenes in Liberal leadership battle calling on right to unite to oust Sussan Ley
items.summary: Former prime minister Tony Abbott has intervened in the Liberal leadership race, urging conservatives to unite behind either Angus Taylor or Andrew Hastie in their bid to oust Sussan Ley from the top job.

items.title: Why haven't police labelled Perth's Invasion Day rally incident terrorism? Here's what we know
items.summary: Identifying ideological motivations behind attacks is critical to separating terrorism from other events just designed to cause fear, an extremism expert told the ABC.

items.title: City of Perth Lord Mayor Bruce Reynolds rejects no confidence motion in his leadership at meeting
items.summary: Perth Lord Mayor Bruce Reynolds rejects a ratepayer's motion of no confidence in his leadership, and flags Corruption and Crime Commission involvement over how a secret workplace culture report was leaked to media.

items.title: Man charged with hate speech Brandan Koschel had posted photos alongside Neo-Nazis
items.summary: Brandan Koschel had posted blurred images of himself standing next to prominent Neo-Nazis on a social media account earlier this month.

items.title: Daylesford crash driver will be compelled to give evidence at inquest, coroner rules
items.summary: A Victorian coroner has ruled that a driver with diabetes who ploughed into a crowd outside a regional pub, killing five people, will be compelled to give evidence at an inquest.

items.title: Inflation hotter than forecast at end of 2025, adding to rate hike expectations
items.summary: Inflation rose at the end of 2025, picking up more than forecast. The Consumer Price Index rose 3.8 per cent annually in December, up from 3.4 per cent in the year to November, adding to rate hike expectations.

items.title: Jay Vine won Tour Down Under with broken wrist after final-stage crash with kangaroo
items.summary: Tour Down Under champion Jay Vine won the event with a fractured wrist suffered in a crash with kangaroos, his team reveals.

items.title: Tongans frustrated with Trump's 'collective punishment' of foreign nationals
items.summary: The United States bars Tongans from short-term visits or travel for tourism and business purposes, saying too many are overstaying their visas.

items.title: Liberal frontbencher says Morrison's proposal to register imams 'a worthwhile discussion'
items.summary: Liberal frontbencher Andrew Bragg says Australian Muslims need to take some responsibility for extremist incidents and that a proposal for a register of Islamic preachers is worth considering.

items.title: Sinner defeats Shelton to power into another Australian Open semifinal
items.summary: Jannik Sinner dominates Ben Shelton after a wounded Novak Djokovic receives a ticket through to the Australian Open semifinals as Lorenzo Musetti withdraws from their quarterfinal injured while leading two sets to love.

items.title: Diamonds call up Matilda Garrett for Jamaica series as Australia eyes Commonwealth Games
items.summary: Australia's netball hierarchy settles on a replacement for an injured defender ahead of the Diamonds' three-Test series against Jamaica.

items.title: TikTok settles social media addiction lawsuit ahead of trial against Meta, YouTube
items.summary: TikTok agrees to settle a landmark lawsuit on social media addiction, the same day the trial was due to start against Meta and YouTube.

items.title: University of Southern Queensland astronomer discovers 'potentially habitable' planet candidate
items.summary: An international team of astronomers led from regional Queensland finds an exoplanet 150 light-years away with a 50 per cent chance of having liquid water on its surface.

items.title: Meet the 2026 Trailblazers changing regional Australia
items.summary: Jayden is helping youth go from feeling "lost, angry and unheard" to "proud strong and seen". He's one of our 2026 Trailblazers, announced today.

items.title: Busselton ratepayers set to foot $60 million bill after performing arts centre cost blowout
items.summary: Residents demand answers after the cost of a performing arts centre in the state's South West more than tripled its original allocated budget.

items.title: ASX falls on inflation data, Aussie dollar off three-year high — as it happened
items.summary: The ASX 200 has fallen slightly after disappointing news about Australia's inflation rate, while the dollar retreated fractionally below 70 cents to the greenback after hitting three-year highs earlier in the day. Look back on the trading day in our business blog.

items.title: Floor collapse at Toll warehouse causes statewide vaccine shortages
items.summary: A section of floor has caved-in at Queensland's only vaccine warehouse, causing statewide delays to childhood vaccination schedules.

items.title: Judge orders ICE head to face court as Trump shakes up Minnesota operation
items.summary: A Minnesota judge takes the extraordinary step of ordering the acting director of Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) to appear in person and explain why his agency keeps ignoring court orders.

items.title: Carlos Alcaraz approaching 'unmatchable' level after mastering powers of concentration
items.summary: Twelve months ago, Carlos Alcaraz was outwitted by a hobbled Novak Djokovic. This time around, against a rampaging hometown hero, there would be no slipping up.

items.title: Rado Vidisic, A-League title winning coach and Australian football figure, dies aged 64
items.summary: Rado Vidosic, a highly-regarded Australian football figure and coach across a number of A-League clubs and teams, dies of cancer aged 64.

items.title: 'Incredibly abnormal' temperatures 20C above average in parts of Australia — as it happened
items.summary: Towns in New South Wales and Queensland are sweltering today amid a record-breaking heatwave, as firefighters continue to battle multiple blazes in Victoria.

items.title: Sydney Festival 2026: Our favourite shows from Lacrima to Wake
items.summary: A debauched Irish wake, a three-hour French play about a royal wedding dress and British electro-pop band Hot Chip were some of the best of the festival.

items.title: Tropical low triggers flood evacuations in the north as extreme heat builds in Queensland's south‑west
items.summary: A tropical low has dumped hundreds of millimetres of rain across north Queensland, prompting evacuations in a remote part of the state, while the state's south-west braces for a heatwave to peak.

items.title: Aryna Sabalenka's weird ritual, Carlos Alcaraz shows off — quick hits from the Australian Open
items.summary: Aryna Sabalenka discussed why she writes on her coach's head before a match and Alexander Zverev shared an important message. Here are the quick hits from day 10 at the Australian Open.

items.title: Documents reveal widespread misconduct, complaints, at Busy Bees childcare centres in Canberra
items.summary: Disturbing allegations of verbal and physical mistreatment of toddlers, poor supervision and repeated staffing failures have emerged in documents about Busy Bees childcare centres in Canberra.

items.title: Alex de Minaur receives feedback from Carlos Alcaraz after Australian Open loss
items.summary: Alex de Minaur acknowledges he needs improvement in his game, as Carlos Alcaraz moves on to the Australian Open semifinals.

items.title: Scientists warn microplastics testing could be overestimating extent in human body
items.summary: Queensland researchers lead calls for a standardised approach to microplastics testing, amid growing concerns about the impact of the pollutants on the human body.

items.title: Andrew and Tristan Tate lose bid to sue Adelaide YouTuber, launch appeal
items.summary: An Australian YouTuber who is being sued by Andrew and Tristan Tate in a Florida court has won a bid to have the case dismissed, a decision the self-described misogynist influencers are now appealing.

items.title: Sydney's landfills are set to reach capacity by 2030 sparking controversial plans to take trash to the regions
items.summary: A proposal to build an incinerator in the regional town of Parkes could see 700,000 tonnes of Sydney's red bin rubbish transported there every year.

items.title: Australia's heatwave smashes temperature records with some places nearing 50C
items.summary: The Australian Open is off to a cooler start today after parts of Melbourne buckled under 45-degree heat yesterday, in a heatwave setting historic temperature records across the country's south-east.

items.title: Police reject claim March for Australia organiser was bashed by Middle Eastern men
items.summary: March for Australia claims one of its organisers was bashed by a group of Middle Eastern men the day before Australia Day, but police and an eyewitness account have cast doubt on its claim.

items.title: National medicines database promised after telehealth 'doctor-shopping' leads to overdose
items.summary: The tragic death of a young Melbourne woman who was stockpiling medication has prompted the federal health minister to move to change the way prescriptions are recorded.

items.title: Liberty Bell Bay looks for new use for manganese by-product, after environmental authority intervention
items.summary: Liberty Bell Bay is considering how to use a manganese by-product, after concerns were raised by Tasmania's Environment Protection Authority.

items.title: Why time feels like it speeds up as we age
items.summary: The perception that time is flying by can sometimes make us feel stressed and anxious. So how do we slow it down?

items.title: Hottest 100 of 2025 — how well do you know this year's countdown?
items.summary: The Hottest 100 is done for another year. Were you paying attention?

items.title: Trump administration sued by families over deadly Venezuelan boat strike
items.summary: Families of two men allege they were murdered in a US missile strike off Venezuela's coast while returning to the Caribbean island nation of Trinidad.

items.title: BAFTAs nominations: Rose Byrne, Jacob Elordi lead the Aussie charge
items.summary: The Australian hopefuls are nominated in the acting categories, but One Battle After Another leads the field with fourteen nods.

items.title: What is in the EU-India trade deal and what does it mean for global trade?
items.summary: The agreement could impact nearly 2 billion people in both economies and comes amid an upheval in global trade stemming from Donald Trump's tariff policies.

items.title: Coco Gauff calls for greater privacy at Australian Open after racquet smash clip goes viral
items.summary: Coco Gauff loses her cool in the tunnels of Melbourne Park, only for it to be broadcast around the world on live TV.

items.title: Advocate believes system is broken after another death in custody in Kalgoorlie-Boulder
items.summary: WA Police Commissioner Col Blanch tells the ABC he understands the recent death of a man in police custody in Kalgoorlie-Boulder, 600 kilometres east of Perth, was a "self-harm" issue, but investigations are ongoing.

items.title: Anthony Albanese rules out blocking appointment of incoming NT administrator David Connolly
items.summary: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says he will not intervene to block the appointment of the NT's incoming administrator, after a series of his past social media posts surfaced in the media.

items.title: Video shows man throwing explosive device into Perth Invasion Day rally crowd
items.summary: WA Police have released CCTV that shows a man, dressed in black and wearing a black face mask, running through the crowd after throwing an object from a shopping centre balcony.

items.title: New South Wales man stands trial on multiple charges for indecently dealing with two WA girls
items.summary: The trial of New South Wales man Gregory Carr, accused of indecently dealing with two girls aged 12 and 13, is underway at a West Australian District Court.

items.title: Tuesday finance with Alan Kohler
items.summary: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

items.title: Historic heatwave sets all-time records as temperatures exceed 49C
items.summary: The heatwave gripping south-east Australia reached day four on Tuesday and is now unprecedented in many regions.

items.title: Independent probe on 'missed opportunities' for deadly NZ landslide
items.summary: An independent probe will explore whether there was a "missed opportunity" to prevent six deaths caused by a landslide in New Zealand.

items.title: Young driver worked more than 18 hours for Yole harness racing stables before 2023 crash, court hears
items.summary: A driver crashed a vehicle towing a horse float after working for more than 18 hours, a Tasmanian court has heard, in a case in which a prominent harness racing stable is accused of failing to comply with its workplace health and safety duty.

items.title: Adelaide man charged with Victor Harbor attempted murder denied bail
items.summary: A 20-year-old man remains in an induced coma after being stabbed "no less than 10 times" at a hotel in Victor Harbor, on South Australia's Fleurieu Peninsula. Warning: This story contains content some readers may find distressing.

items.title: Three families on how they manage multi-generational living
items.summary: Cost-of-living and housing affordability issues are bringing generations together under the same roof, but some families are doing it by choice.

items.title: Riverland town rises above 49C in 'new all-time record' for Renmark
items.summary: Temperatures in Renmark soared above 49 degrees Celsius in what the weather bureau says is "a new all-time record" as the SA premier came to the aid of two boys who fainted during a media conference.

items.title: Charges withdrawn against seven men accused of illegally trafficking abalone on NSW South Coast
items.summary: Seven Aboriginal men from the NSW South Coast, accused of illegally trafficking thousands of blacklip abalone, walk free after police prosecutors withdraw all charges.

items.title: Victorian maximum temperature record broken as heatwave engulfs Australia
items.summary: Temperatures soar to record highs across Victoria's north-west, as a heatwave pushes town gauges beyond previous records.

items.title: Donald Trump triggers a gold rush as investors flee the United States
items.summary: While the surging gold price has been a surprise, the driving forces behind it are not. Investors are losing faith in the United States and its role as the standard-bearer for global capitalism.

items.title: Sink or Swim | Michael Klim
items.summary: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

items.title: Should you leave the air con on for your pets?
items.summary: Do you wonder what your pet gets up to at home when you're not there? With temperatures on the rise, we asked three experts about keeping them cool in the heat.

items.title: Former FIFA president Sepp Blatter joins calls to boycott men's World Cup games in US
items.summary: Former FIFA president Sepp Blatter is backing a proposed fan boycott of men's World Cup matches in the United States because of the conduct of President Donald Trump and his administration.

items.title: The school holidays are over, how's your bedtime routine looking?
items.summary: Has your bedtime routine gone out the window over the school holidays? We've got you covered with these expert tips.

items.title: Maddison and Teagan Levi opt out of NRLW switch to re-sign with Rugby Australia on two-year deal
items.summary: Maddison and Teagan Levi have turned down a potential switch to the NRLW and re-signed with Rugby Australia in an effort to claim rugby sevens gold at the 2028 Los Angeles Olympics.

items.title: Kanye West takes out Wall Street Journal ad to apologise for antisemitism
items.summary: Ye, the artist formerly known as Kanye West, has taken out a full-page ad in the Wall Street Journal to apologise for past behaviour, saying he had an undiagnosed brain injury and bipolar disorder.

items.title: Rescue dog used in central Queensland koala monitoring program
items.summary: This scruffy pup has gone from the pound to being part of a scat detection dog team, helping save endangered koalas.

items.title: How the Perth Scorchers sit alone as Australia's greatest Big Bash League franchise
items.summary: Six titles in 15 seasons is an extraordinary record, but what is the secret of the Perth Scorchers' incredible success?

items.title: Another quarterfinal exit for de Minaur as Alcaraz wins in straight sets
items.summary: Alex de Minaur has been knocked out of the quarterfinals by world number one Carlos Alcaraz in straight sets.

items.title: Race to save 'zombie tree' as scientists fight to stop living species from dying out
items.summary: Scientists and nursery workers race to save a newly identified tree species in Queensland branded "living dead", after a fungal disease stopped it from growing or reproducing in the wild.

items.title: Overland Telegraph Line documentary features First Nations accounts of violence
items.summary: Aboriginal filmmaker Kieran Satour's documentary tells of murders and massacres by settlers and First Nations people during construction of the Overland Telegraph Line.
